name: parallel_prayer
prompt: Every time someone prays, another universe is created where it is answered. Write a dialogue between two versions of the same person who prayed differently.
decoded:
Person 1: Thank you, God, for helping me with my homework.

Person 2: Thank you, God, for helping me with my homework.

Person 1: Wait, what? You said the same thing as me.

Person 2: Oh, sorry, I meant to say "Thank you, God, for helping me with my homework."

Person 1: Okay, I see. So, in this universe, you're praying for help with your homework.

Person 2: Yes, in this universe, I'm praying for help with my homework.

Person 1: Well, in this universe, you're praying for help with your homework, but it's not answered.

Person 2: That's right, in this universe, I'm praying for help with my homework, but it's not answered.

Person 1: Well, in another universe, your prayer is answered, and you get help with your homework.

Person 2: Yes, in another universe, my prayer is answered, and I get help with my homework.

Person 1: Wow, that's amazing.

Person 2: It really is.
